{{infobox character | people=[[Númenóreans|Númenórean]] | name=Inzilbêth | image=Juliana Pinho - Faithful Family - Inzilbeth and Inziladun.png | caption="Faithful Family - Inzilbeth and Inziladun" by [[:Category:Images by Juliana Pinho|Juliana Pinho]] | pronun= | othernames= | titles=Queen of Númenor | position= | location=[[Númenor]] | affiliation=The [[Faithful]] | language=[[Adûnaic]] and [[Sindarin]] | birth=Before {{SA|3035}}{{UT|Kings}}, entry XXIV ''Tar-Palantir (Ar-Inziladûn)'' | birthlocation= | rule= | death= | deathlocation= | age= | notablefor= | house= [[House of Elros]] | parentage=[[Lindórië]] & unnamed great-grandson of [[Gimilzagar]] | siblings= | spouse=[[Ar-Gimilzôr]] | children=[[Tar-Palantir|Inziladûn]] and [[Gimilkhâd]] | gender=Female | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Inzilbêth''' was a [[Queen of Númenor|Queen]] of [[Númenor]]. ==History== She was the daughter of [[Lindórië]], who was the sister of [[Eärendur (Lord of Andúnië)|Eärendur]], the fifteenth [[Lords of Andúnië|Lord of Andúnië]],{{S|Akallabeth}} and a descendant of [[Tar-Calmacil]].{{UT|Kings}}, entry XXIII ''Ar-Gimilzôr (Tar-Telemnar)'' Her family was secretly [[Faithful]] and she had been taught by her mother. As such, when [[Ar-Gimilzôr]] asked her for marriage, she refused but Ar-Gimilzôr did not allow his wishes to be denied. There was no love between Inzilbêth and her husband or between her sons. Her elder son [[Inziladûn]], who would take the royal title of [[Tar-Palantir]], followed her teachings rather than his father's when he became King of Númenor. Her younger son [[Gimilkhâd]] however, would follow in the footsteps of his father. == Etymology == ''Inzilbêth'' is an [[Adûnaic]] name. Its meaning is not glossed, but Paul Strack suggests it means "Flower-word" and is a compound of ''[[inzil]]'' ("flower") and ''[[bêth]]'' ("word").{{webcite|author=Paul Strack|articleurl=http://www.eldamo.org/content/words/word-320160757.html|articlename=Ad.
